meanings.definition: A person who talks at length without making much sense.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the blellums kept rambling on without any clear point.
meanings.sent2: The blellums in the class always had a story to share, even if it didn't make sense to anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The blellums at the party had everyone laughing with their nonsensical jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of blellums, leading to nowhere but confusion.
meanings.sent5: The blellums in the storybook were portrayed as comical characters who never stopped talking.

meanings.definition: To talk at length without making much sense.
meanings.sent1: She would blellums about her day, jumping from one topic to another.
meanings.sent2: When nervous, he tended to blellums, making it hard for others to follow his train of thought.
meanings.sent3: The children would blellums excitedly about their imaginary adventures.
meanings.sent4: His words blellums around the room, creating a cloud of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The politician would blellums during his speeches, leaving the audience puzzled about his intentions.
